reviews.review:
No sé yo, pero es muy simplón y muy corto. Es cierto que hay veces que te quedas pillado y al final lo averiguas pronto como hacerlo.
Y no me arrepiento de haber roto el corazón a GlaDOS porque para empezar, es una ser inerte y segundo, me obligó matar a mi waifu, el Cubo de Compañía, que aparte no tiene alma ni habla, de hecho no puede. 
¿Jugarlo de nuevo para los logros, los desafíos y las cámaras avanzadas? No creo que en corto plazo.
Sin embargo, es un juego de experimentación de hacer trastadas con la arma de portales para hacer tus chorradas como bucles infinitos y me lo he pasado como un crío.
No sé quién le dió sueño, pero más malo es 5 madrugadas en "Al ca Fede"(nombre ficticio de videojuego basado en otro juego). ¡Ese sí que me da sueño, sólo son jumpscares para que los youtubers y "S" obtenga dinero fácil y que sus ejércitos personales defienda a los detractores y hagan sus versiones.
chamber 15 is impossible

Now I'm playing the game again picking up radios and waving them around in every chambers like an idiot
10/10 would radio again
Yes!

Dans la grande famille des jeux vidéo, j'ai pris l'habitude de commencer toujours par le plus moderne, le plus récent.
Ainsi ai-je fait mes premiers pas sur Portal 2, qui en plus d'être intéressant, dur et bien complet, se révèle aussi être LE JEU qui ne m'a jamais autant fait rire depuis que je l'ai commencé.
Rapidement emporté par le succès de ce jeu, j'ai donc décidé de me mettre au premier volet, qui était aussi dans le pack "The Orange Box".
Personnellement, Le premier s'avère un peu plus lassant que le deuxième (pour ne pas m'attirer la foudre des joueurs, je vais m'expliquer).
Dans Portal 2, vous étiez guidé continuellement par le décor, les voix de GlaDOS, Wheathley et l'esthétique charmeuse des lieux (qui m'a marqué).
Dans Portal, c'est un peu moins le cas, le jeu vous délaissant une fois mis devant les énigmes.
Certes, le jeu conserve une esthétique accrocheuse qui sera reprise dans le deuxième volet avec quelques retouches,
mais on ne peut que regretter l'absence des formidables éditeur de salles de tests et mode coop qui ont aussi fait la renommée du deuxième volet.
Force est de contaster que sur des Portal-like comme The Talos Principle, l'absence de mode coop se ressent immédiatement pour qui a joué à Portal 2.
En résumé, Portal reste un excellent jeu qui a posé les bases du deuxième volet et instauré la philosophie de la "saga", et l'absence de mode coop ne touchera que les gros fans du deuxième volet, et pas les débutants.
j'ai bien aimé tuer GlaDoS à la fin !

Have you seen any of the other surrounding reviews? Most of them all pretty much have one thing in common. They say buy this Game and guess what? I agree with those said reviews. YOU SHOULD AND MOST DEFINITELY BUY THIS GAME! Still not convinced? Well you can see more info and reasons to get this game coming from someone who has done a complete playthrough of it on Youtube (Which you can watch here because Shameless Self-Promotion: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLP8qVdrB0HJEJsxvRvlzVqzYXQ4Y1qLH-) below.

Reasons to Get This Game:
1. It is simple and Easy to Pick Up and Play
2. The Writing and dialog in this game is top-notch
3. The Portal Gun is a very fun tool to play around with.
4. The Game is a puzzle game that does make you think but isn't overwhelmingly hard. The Difficulty curve apart from the extra challenge levels is nice and solid enough for a newcomer to become a Portaling Pro at the end of the game.
5. The Music in this game fits the mood and tone of the game so well, Especially the later parts.
6.  It's a Valve game meaning it will be good and I have listed more reasons here than the number of Sequels Valve can Count up to.
7. There are Extra Challenge Levels for the Hardcore Players looking for a challenge.
8. GLaDOs is a very memorable character! I MEAN VERY MEMORABLE!
9. The game does not overwhelmingly punish you for making mistakes which can help a new player ease into making progress.
10. It is a good enough game for me to make a playthrough of it on Youtube. I don't usually do Playthroughs of games that I don't recommend.
11. See Reasons 1-10.
12. It is a Valve Game! A VALVE GAME!
13. I'm running out of reasons because Reasons.
14. You Should have Brought this game already if you're still reading this.
15. Portal is fun. I Recommend it! End of Story!

If there is anything negative I have to say about this game, I only can just say that the Overall Game Experience lasts way too short in my opinion. Thankfully, There's extra Challenges and levels you can do and there is the Sequel which easily solves this problem but I HIGHLY RECOMMEND PLAYING THIS GAME BEFORE PLAYING THE SEQUEL (I can't emphasize it enough).

Anyway, If you're still reading this, you should definitely be convinced to get this game after reading this sentence. If not, just watch my Youtube Playthrough using the link above and watch me have fun with the game because maybe you just visually need to see someone have fun with the game before playing it yourself. 

So thanks for reading this review of Portal. Enjoy the game and Game On!

Portal is my favorite game of all time, uncontested. I've completed it about 12 times. It's definitly the smartest game ever created, but it's also very short. I like this game much better than I like Portal 2. Portal 2 was almost a comedy game, while Portal 1 is more ambient and dark, and in the last four test chambers [spoiler] the Ratman Dens makes it feel sort of a horror game, and soundtracks like Self Esteem Fund really makes it feel like you're alone. I had to take a walk after I played the game for my first time, just to see people again[/spoiler]. I love this game and I'd really like Portal 3 if/when it comes out to be more like Portal 1 than Portal 2. Don't get me wrong, Portal 2 is an awesome game, but Portal 1 remains the better game. If you've never played this, give it a go, and if you've already beaten it, go play it again!
Was one of my top 10 most anticipated games

Portal is a short but sweet first person puzzle game, with great writing, intelligent pacing, and a truly sublime main mechanic that was all the more stunning when it first came out in 2007. It was also one of the 5 titles in the Orange Box collection, which was my personal introduction to Valve's games. And it's [i]still[/i] good. The mystery and horror ambiance this game exudes is unmatched, even by Portal 2.

Advanced levels and level challenges are available once you've finished the main story. There is also custom map support (no Steam Workshop here) with plenty of levels to be found on the internet.

No multiplayer, and nothing like the gels, lasers and light bridges from [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/230290/]its sequel[/url] - but maybe we don't need those here.

Buy this if you like good games and gaming history.
Valve should add a voice saying "thank you for helping us help you help us all" when you reviewed this game

Portal  
Los incios de esta franquisia que sin duda alguna, persona que le encante los juegos de tipo Puzzle debe tener en su biblioteca.

Traida por Valve, portal busca combinar el FPS con ambiente Puzzle donde la mecanica es ir disparando portales de dos tipos Azul y Naranja, ambos portales que se disparan estan interconectados y seran muy recurrentes tanto como al inicio como al final.

el chiste es ir pasando de camara de pruebas, obiamente resolviendolas pero cuidado en estos ambientes tambien hay peligros como:
- Torretas
- Agua toxica
- Bolas de energia

Tambien el juego cuenta con modos de retos donde nos colocan en verciones de las camaras de pruebas pero mas dificiles y tambien con modo carrera donde trataras de pasar camaras de prueba con el menor uso de portales
estas modalidades añaden mas tiempo a la experiencia apesar de que el juego no dura mucho si eres listo y rapido en resolver los puzzles

en cuanto los personajes solo puedo decir que GlaDos me saco una risa en mas de una ocacion 

en conclucion 
portal es una compra segura para los que quieran experimentar otro consepto del uso de los FPS y mas con las baratas no sera dificil conseguirlo
A game you can surely beat in an afternoon 10/10
Mały dodatek do Organge Boxa , który stał się legendą gier logicznych .

Released within the Orange Box in 2007, Portal was quite unexpected, at least compared to Team Fortress 2 and Half Life 2 : Episode 2, which were the stars of the Orange Box at that time. With its short single-player campaign, and its stripped down graphics (close in term of quality to Half Life 2, released years prior), Portal was to be considered as a bonus in the Orange Box, or even some kind of draft.

Yet, Portal managed to stir up the curiosity and the interest of the gaming community. First, the story line is as simple as it is mysterious. Portal is set in the Half Life universe, seemingly at the same time as the first Half Life. The main character is Chell, a young and mute Gordon Freeman-like woman, who wakes up in a huge complex, belonging to Aperture Science, the main competitor of Black Mesa. Chell will be guided by GLaDOS, a strange AI, through a series of "tests", in order to attend some kind of "party".

What first looks like a training level slowly evolves toward a mix of FPS and puzzle game, as the player will have to use the portal gun to solve the "tests", which consists in 3D physics enigmas. Create a blue and an orange portal, and what goes through one portal comes out of the other with the same momentum. You then will have to use the law of physics to solve the puzzles. This original concept provides a very interesting and intelligent challenge. It's just a shame that Portal was developped as a mini-game, so it's neither long nor difficult.

But aside form this originality, the atmosphere of Portal is quite intriguing. Nothing is explained regarding to why Chell is here, or to who she is (hence the simplicity of the sotry !). And as she travels through this disturbingly empty complex, she is permanently lectured by GLaDOS. The AI was seeminlgy conceived as a twisted version of HAL 9000, with its quiet voice, but dangerous schemes and worrying speech elements. And let's not forget the famous  and popular closing song, "Still Alive", sung by GLaDOS.

All of this allow for a unique experience, that I recommend you to try, at least for a few hours (you won't need much more to complete the campaign).

Not to mention I love its ambient music and the darker GlaDOS. Its jokes always get me smiling.

Portal is a fantastically different puzzle game.  A first person shooter with no guns!  Well, apart from the Portal gun of course.  It's short, as it was never really anything other than an experiment from Valve included with the Orange Box - you're probably looking at a couple of hours - but those hours are glorious!

Ok so it's not as polished as Portal 2, but you really should play it - if only to learn why the cake is a lie!

Portal is an interesting puzzle game which is quite a challenge, but not so hard that I had to resort to a walk-though. The graphics are as good as they need to be, and the abundant monologue from Aperture Science Laboratories computer system GLaDOS is very entertaining.

I'll start off with saying the campaign is SHORT. REAALLY SHOOORT. It took my two hours to beat the game and that's with struggling in the last leg of the game. Despite the game's short length, it is really good!

No other game that I have played has so much sarcastic, deadpan humor given to you. What makes it even funnier is you hear them from a completely robotic voice and it makes it so much funnier. 

Example: "As part of a previously mentioned required test protocol, we can no longer lie to you. When the testing is over, you will be missed." 

Get this game. Laugh. Die. Laugh.
great game. provides an excellent story and memorable charachters. the ovarall game is really short but it's fun while it lasts.

Portal é um jogo de ação/puzzle em primeira pessoa desenvolvido pela Valve Corporation, lançado junto com a compilação de jogos "Orange Box" pela Valve em 10 de Outubro de 2007. Nesse pacote de jogos tem incluído alguns famosos jogos da Valve, por exemplo: Half-life 2, Half-life 2: Episode One, Half-Life 2: Epsisode Two, Team Fortress 2 e o estreante jogo da produtora, Portal. O jogo consiste basicamente de uma série de enigmas que devem ser solucionados ao teletransportar o personagem do jogador e outros objetos simples usando o "Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device" ("ASHPD", também conhecido como "Portal Gun").

No jogo você assume o papel da Chell, uma cobaia dos testes produzidas pela Aperture Sciencie. Ela é a silenciosa protagonista de Portal e da campanha single-player em Portal 2. Muito pouco se sabe sobre seu passado, além de seu possível abandono quando nasceu e sua teimosa vontade de viver [spoiler] (Baseado nos eventos de Portal 2, é debatido que Chell talvez seja a filha de algum cientista que trabalhou na Aperture Science) [/spoiler]. Durante os testes na empresa, o jogador é guiado por GLaDOS, um computador de inteligência artificial que monitora e direciona o jogador.

Portal foi um ótimo jogo, apesar da própria Valve considerar que foi apenas um jogo teste para o seu sucessor, Portal 2 e que não acreditava que o jogo seria tão bem recebido pela crítica e usuários. O jogo revolucionou os jogos do gênero puzzle e sem dúvida nenhuma, vale muito a pena comprar Portal e aproveitar tudo que o jogo oferece. Até a próxima análise! :D
portal is my life!

Com Portal vc joga com a personagem Chell que tenta fugir de uma das camaras do laboratório Aperture, ela usa uma Portal Gun que é uma arma que dispara portais e com isso você simula sua entrada e saída nas paredes, no chão e em tudo que o jogo permitir, o jogo oferece uma gama de desafios e dificuldades pra vc jogar e é claro, com muito humor e bizarrices ao mesmo tempo, ótimo jogo pra quem procura um plataforma de jogos de ação, inteligência e puzzles, recomendo :)
